reply: To resolve issues: select the checkboxes next to issues, click "Resolve Selected", provide an optional action note, then confirm. Issues marked as resolved will be auto-deleted after 2 minutes.
To export issues as CSV: open the Issues tab and click "Export CSV". A file named issues.csv will be downloaded containing ticket, category, message, phone, status and action metadata.
To change your password: click the "Change Password" button in the top-right, provide your current and new password, then submit. Passwords must be at least 6 characters long.
USSD interactions are visible under the USSD tab (MCA only). You can review recent interactions, phone numbers, parsed input and responses there. PA and CLERK roles don't have access to this feature.

The parsed_text field contains structured data extracted from the user input (for example JSON or key-value pairs). Use it to quickly understand the user intent â€” open the USSD tab and inspect the parsed_text column for each interaction.
To search by phone: open the USSD or Constituents tab and use the search box (or export CSV and filter). You can also search within the Issues tab using the search functionality.
Notifications (SMS) have been disabled in this deployment. Reporters will not receive SMS. Use the in-dashboard tools to manage and update reports.
I can help with: issues management, bursaries, announcements, constituents, user roles, profile settings, data export, and general dashboard questions. Ask me anything!
View bursary applications in the Bursaries tab. You can see applicant details, status, and manage applications. Both MCA and PA/CLERK roles have access to this section.
To create announcements: Go to Announcements tab, click "New Announcement", enter title and message, then publish. All user roles (MCA, PA, CLERK) can create announcements.
Constituents are ward members registered in the system. Only MCA role can access the Constituents tab to view and manage member data. PA and CLERK roles don't have access.

Issues are problems or requests reported by constituents. You can view, update status (pending/in progress/resolved), add action notes, and resolve multiple issues at once. Issues auto-delete 2 minutes after being marked as resolved.
To update your profile picture: Click your avatar in the top-right, select "Update Profile Picture", choose an image from your device, and upload. Supported formats: JPG, PNG, GIF (max 5MB).
Only MCA role can manage users (User Management tab). Maximum 3 total users allowed: 1 MCA (full access) + 2 PA/CLERK (limited access). PA and CLERK can self-register if under the limit.
User roles: MCA (full access to everything), PA (access to Issues, Bursaries, Announcements), CLERK (same as PA). Only MCA can access Constituents, USSD Interactions, and User Management.

Use your username and password to login. Default admin credentials: username 'admin', password 'admin123' (change after first login). If you can't login, verify your credentials or contact the MCA administrator.
PA and CLERK roles can self-register if under 3 total users. Click "Sign Up" on login page, enter your details, and choose role (CLERK or PA). MCA users must be created by existing MCA.
Issues marked as 'resolved' are automatically deleted after 2 minutes. You can also bulk-delete by resolving multiple issues at once. Individual manual deletion may require MCA access.
Issue statuses: Pending (new/unhandled), In Progress (being worked on), Resolved (completed/fixed). Change status using the dropdown in each issue row and click 'Save' to apply changes.

Dashboard tabs: Issues (all roles), Bursaries (all roles), Constituents (MCA only), Announcements (all roles), USSD Interactions (MCA only), User Management (MCA only). Your visible tabs depend on your role.
The dashboard shows statistics cards at the top: Total Issues, Pending Issues, Resolved Issues, Total Constituents, Bursaries, and Announcements. These update in real-time as data changes.
Action notes are comments or updates added when resolving issues. They help document what was done to resolve the issue. Add them in the 'Action Note' field before saving issue status changes.
To logout: Click the 'Logout' button in the top-right corner of the dashboard. You'll be redirected to the login page.
The system allows maximum 3 total users: 1 MCA (main admin with full access) + 2 additional users (PA or CLERK with limited access). This limit is enforced during signup and user creation.
I'm the CHATBOT AI assistant! I help you navigate the dashboard, answer questions about features, and guide you through common tasks. Ask me anything about the system!
Issues marked as 'resolved' are automatically deleted 2 minutes after status change. You'll see a notification when this happens. This helps keep the dashboard clean and focused on active issues.
